page.title: 11Communications In Mayfield.
page.content: Mayfield has its own small Telephone Exchange,a comparatively new building to replace the old one which was totally demolished by an explosion in 1978.The Exchange is of particular significance to the Primary School in Mayfield as a 'Time Capsule'was placed by them in the foundations of the new Exchange during its construction.The metal box contains photographs,coins, tapes & other articles which will be of interest to archaeologists of the future. Mayfield has 2 Post Offices & many post boxes scattered throughout the village.There are 2 deliveries each day,both in the morning,& 2 collections per day,1 in the morning &1 in the afternoon.As Mayfield is so rural push_bike & foot_rounds are not common.Instead P.O.vans deliver the mail.
